page.title: 11PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content:
{The Half Moon (Warninglid)}has been a public house for about 200 years,it was built in the early 16th century. The present landlord has been here for 2 years.He rents the pub from a brewery.He is not paid a wage but earns his money from the profits on the food and drinks. Most of his customers are regulars of 30-40 years old and prefer the old traditional ales.His busiest day is Saturday when families stop for a drink on their day out.
{The Chequers (Slaugham) The landlord of the Chequers has owned it for about a year and a half.He has another job as the manager of the James King in Pease Pottage.The Chequers has been a pub since 1780,but was a shop for 70 years before that.
